title: Can anyone identify these characters
content:
Not necesserily the font, only letters.  
They're from the cover of “The Elements of Typographic Style”.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414022213/http:/typophile.com/files/1_29.png) | 33.26 KB |
| [2.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414022213/http:/typophile.com/files/2_18.png) | 159.66 KB |
author: inktrap

comments.content: i would guess by the rest of the character grouping that they are also e's, perhaps just in different alphabets/languages. ?
You're right. The n-looking one is probably Greek Eta (η). Any idea about the font?

Well 2.png is the Greek letter eta. As for 1.png, it corresponds to [the open-mid central rounded vowel](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414022213/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open-mid_central_rounded_vowel) (in IPA, the international phonetic alphabet) and the tilde on top of it should mean that it is nasalized.
